The digit 6 is "5 or greater". So, should we round up or round down?

content.html:
"Let’s try a tricky one!" Nic said. "What is 35 rounded to the thousands place?"

“Wait a minute…there’s no thousands place in 35,” Jaime said.

“Good catch!" said Nic. "Remember, you can add 0s to the left of the number without changing its value. If we put placeholder 0s to the left of 35, we can turn it into 0035, and it now has a thousands place!”

"I see!" said Jaime. "Yes, this makes sense because 35 has 0 thousands and 0 hundreds."

"Right!" said Nic. “So, what is 35 rounded to the thousands place?”

hi.html: Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Hum hajaaron staan ke daen or ka ank 0 hai. Toh humme neeche ka ya upar ka anumaan karna hai? Phir se koshish karo!

"Ab, hum thoda kathin savaal karte hain!" Nikki ne kaha. "35 hajaaron staan ka anumaan kya hoga?"

"Ek minute, 35 mein hajaaron ka staan hai he nahi!" Jay ne kaha.

"Sahi pakda, Jay!" Nikki ne kaha. "Yaad rakho, aap iske mooly ko badale bina sankhya ke baeen or 0 ko jod sakate hain. Yadi agar ham ko 0 35 ke baeen or rakhate hain, to yeh 0035 mein badal sakate hain, aur ab isaka sthaan hajaaron mein hai! ”

"Mai samajhgaya!" Jay ne kaha. "Haan, yah samajh mein aata hai, kyunki 35 mein 0 hajaaron aur 0 saikadon hain."

"Sahi!" Nikki ne kaha. "to, 35 hajaaron staan ka anumaan kya hoga?"
Sahi hai!
Hajaaron staan ka daen wala ank 0 hai. Yeh 5 se chota hai, isliye humme neeche ka anumaan lagaana hai.
Neeche ka anumaan lagane mein, hum hajaaron staan ka ank waise he chod dete hain, aur baaki daen staanon ke ankon ko 0 bana dete hain.
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Agar aap hajaaron staan tak anumaan kar rahe hai, toh daen ke saare ank 0 hone chahiye.

feedback.html: That's right. Good job. That was a tough one!

That's not right. Remember, when rounding to the nearest hundreds place, we round down when the digit to the right of the hundreds place is below 5. When the digit to the right of the hundreds place is 5 or above, we need to round up. Try again.

No, that's not right. Since the digit to the right of the hundreds place is 5, we need to round the number up. So, if we were rounding '956' up to the hundreds place, the closest hundred would be 1000. 

However, the number is 9956. To round up to find the closest hundred, the answer would have to be a number with the closest hundred which is larger than 9956. 1000 is smaller than 9956. Try again!
No, that's not right. You've rounded the number to the closest 10. But, we need to do it to the closest hundred. Try again!

content.html: "Round 9,956 to the nearest hundreds place." said Nic.

"Can you show me how to round a number?" asked Jaime.

"Sure!" said Nic. "Let's round 165 to the nearest ten. We'll need to follow the steps below:

  1. Find the digit at the place you're rounding to.
  2. Look at the digit one place to its right. If that digit is 5 or bigger, we should round up. This means adding 1 to the digit in the place you’re rounding to.
  3. Everything to the right of that digit then becomes 0.

"See if you can use this to round 165 to the tens place," Nic said.

"OK," said Jaime. "We're rounding to the tens place. The digit on the right of that is 5, so we round up. So, we add 1 to the 6 in the tens place, to get 7. Everything else on the right becomes 0. So, 165 rounds up to 170!"

hi.html:
"Kya aap mujhe dikha sakate hain ki ek sankhya ka anumaan kaise lagaya jaye?" Jay poochha.

"zaroor!" Nikki ne kaha. "Hum 165 ko nikatatam das ka anumaan nikaal te hain.

1. Jis sthaan par aap anumaan rahe hain, us sthaan ko sankhya main dhundo.

2. Wo ank jo usake daeen or ke ek sthaan par hai, usko dekho. Agar woh ank 5 ya phir 5 se bada hai, to hamen upar ka anumaan lagana hai. Isaka matalab hai ki aap us sthaan par 1 ank jod rahe hain jahaan se aap anumaan laga rahe hain.

3. Phir, uss ank ke daeen or pe sab kuchh 0 ho jaata hai.

"Dekho ki kya aap ab 165 ko dasiyon sthaan par anumaan laga sakate hain?" Nikki ne kaha.

"Theek hai," Jay ne kaha. "Hum dasiyon staan par anumaan laga rahe hain. Uss ke daeen or pe ank 5 hai, isliye ham upar ka anumaan laga rahe hain. Isliye, ham dasiyon sthaan par 6 se 1 jodate hain. Wo phir 7 ban jaata hai. Daeen or pe sab kuchh 0 ho jaata hai. to, 165 ka anumaan 170 hai! "

feedback.html: Correct! If we need to add 1 to a 9, then this gives us 10. So, we need to change the 9 to a 0, while adding 1 to the next digit on the left.

You have the correct reasoning, but the answer is wrong.

When you add 1 to the 9 in the tens place, you get 10. So, now you have ten 10s. This means you need to add an extra 1 to the hundreds place, since ten 10s = one 100. You can't just ignore the extra 1.

value: 10,300 because you round up by adding one to the digit in the tens place and turning all digits to the right to zeros
10,290 because you round down by keeping the digit in the tens place the same and turning all digits to the right to zeros
10,307 because you round up by adding one to the digit in the tens place
10,200 because you round up by adding one to the digit in the tens place and turning all digits to the right to zeros

The digit on the right is 7, which is "5 or greater", so you should round up.
Adding 1 to 9 makes 10. This means that the 9 becomes 0, and you should "carry over" the 1 to the digit on the left of the 9.

content.html:
Jaime won the tournament because his score was the highest. But, in order to figure out which grand prize he can trade his points for, he needs to know whether his score is closer to 14,000 or 15,000.

In this lesson, we'll learn how to round numbers to a specific place value. This can help us find numbers that are roughly equal to the original one, but that are easier to remember.

Before we start, make sure you know:

  • The names and ordering of the place values in a number

Also, please first get some paper and a pen or pencil to write with, and find a quiet place to work. Take your time and go through the story at your own pace.

Ready? Click Continue to get started!

hi.html:
Jay ne pratyogita jeeta kyunki uska score sabse bade tha. Lekin, yeh pata lagaane ke lie ki wo kis puraskaar ke liye apne ankon ka vyaapaar kar sakata hai, usse yeh jaanna hoga ki uska score 14000 ya fir 15000 ke kareeb hai.

Iss paath mein, ham seekhenge ki kisee vishisht sthaan maan par sankhyaon ka anumaan kaise lagaya jaye. Yeh humme un sankhyaon ko dhundhne mein madad kar sakata hai jo mool roop se lagabhag baraabar hain, aur unhe yaad rakhana bhi aasaan hai.

shuroo karane se pahale, sunishchit karo ki aap jaanate hain:

kisee sthaan mein sthaan maanon ke naam aur kram.

Kripya kuchh kaagaj aur ek pen ya pencil se likho, aur kaam karane ke lie ek shaant jagah dhoondho. apana samay le lo aur bina kisi jaldi ke aaram se kahaani padho.

taiyaar ho? shuroo karane ke liye continue button par dabao!

content.html:
"I have a question." said Jaime. "What if, when we are rounding up, we need to add a 1 to a place value that has the digit 9 in it? 9 + 1 is 10, but 10 has 2 digits, and we cant put 2 digits in one place value!"

Nic replied, "That's a good question! If we need to add 1 to a 9, then this gives us 10. So, we need to change the 9 to a 0, while carrying the 1 to the next digit on the left."

Jaime was confused. "Could you give me an example?" he asked.

"Sure!" said Nic. "Let's round 2,973 to the hundreds place, which has the digit 9. The digit to the right of the hundreds place is 7, so we need to round up. We add 1 to 9, so it becomes 0, and then we carry the 1 to the place on the left. So, 1 gets added to the 2 in the thousands place, so it becomes 3! Then, as usual, we change the rest of the digits to 0."

"So, the answer is 3,000?" asked Jaime.

"Exactly!" said Nic.

explanation.html:
The digit in the hundreds place of 3958 is 9. The digit to its right is 5, which is "5 or greater", so we need to round up.

This means that we add 1 to the hundreds place. There are already 39 hundreds in the number 3958, and adding 1 gives 40 hundreds.

(We can also see this as follows: adding 1 to the hundreds place gives 10 hundreds. So we write a 0 in the hundreds place, and carry over the 1 to the thousands place. The thousands digit becomes 3 + 1 = 4.)

Finally, after changing everything on the right of the hundreds place to 0, we get the answer: 4000.

feedback.html: Correct!

No, that's not correct. Remember, if the digit is 9 and we're adding 1 to it, we get 10, so we need to carry 1 over to the next number on the left.

Try again!
No, that's not correct. You've rounded to the tens place, but the question is asking about the hundreds place. Try again.
No, that's not correct. Let's try again!

hint_content.html: The digit in the hundreds place is 9.
The digit to the right of the hundreds place is 5. You'll need to decide whether it's "5 or greater", or "4 or smaller". This will tell you whether to round up or round down.
Since 5 is "5 or greater", you should round up.
When rounding up, we need to add 1 to the 9 in the hundreds place. This makes 10. So, we write a 0 in the hundreds place, and "carry over" the 1 by adding it to the digit in the thousands place.

content.html:
“Let’s practice rounding with the digit 9 again.” Nic said.

What is 3,958 rounded to the hundreds place?

hi.html: Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Agar hum 9 ko 1 se add karte hain toh humme 10 milti hai. Toh, humme 9 ko 0 karna hai, aur baen or ka ank ko 1 se add karna hai. Phir se koshish karo!

3958 ke saikadon sthaan par ank 9 hai. Iske daeen or ka ank 5 hai, jo "5 ya adhik" hai, isliye hamen upar ka anumaan lagaana hai.

isaka matalab hai ki ham 1 ko saikadon sthaanon par add karna hain. sankhya 3958 mein pahale se hee 39 saikadon hain, aur 1 ko add karne se 40 saikadon banate hain.

(ham ise is prakaar bhee dekh sakate hain: 1 ko saikadon sthaan par add karne se 10 saikadon milate hain. isalie ham saikadon mein 0 likhate hain, aur 1 ko hajaaron sthaan par le jaate hain. hajaaron ank 3 + 1 = 4 ho jaata hai.)

ant mein, saikadon sthaan ke daeen or sab kuchh 0 mein badalane ke baad, hamen uttar milta hai: 4000.

"Hum phir se 9 ank ke saath anumaan karna seekhte hain." Nikki ne kaha.

3958 saikadon staan ka anumaan kya hoga?
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Savaal saikadon staan tak anumaan puch raha hai, lekin aapne dasiyon staan tak anumaan lagaya hai. Phir se koshish karo.
Sahi hai!
Agar hum 9 ko 1 se add karte hain toh humme 10 milti hai. Toh, humme 9 ko 0 karna hai, aur baen or ka ank ko 1 se add karna hai.
Saikadon staan ka ank 9 hai.
Saikadon staan ka daen or ka ank 5 hai. Kya yeh ank 5 hai ya 5 se bada hai? Ya phir 5 se chhota hai?

content.html:
Jaime and Nic read the grand prize rules. Jaime can exchange his winning score for one of two grand prizes, depending on how much he scores. If his score is closer to 14,000, he can win a basketball. If his score is closer to 15,000, he can win a bike.

“I really want the bike! Do you think my score is closer to 15,000?” Jaime asked.

“Well, let’s see,” said Nic. “We can use rounding to figure out what number it’s closer to.”  

“What’s rounding?” asked Jaime.

“I’ll show you!” Nic said.

hi.html:
Jay aur Nikki ne puraskaar ke niyamon ko padha. Jay do puraskaaron mein se ek ke liye apne score ka aadaan-pradaan kar sakata hai. Agar usaka score 14000 ke kareeb hai, to vah ek basketball jeet sakata hai. Agar usaka skor 15000 ke kareeb hai, to woh cycle jeet sakata hai. “Mujhe ek cycle chahiye! Kya aapako lagata hai ki mera score 15000 ke kareeb hai? ” Jay ne poochha.

"Chalo dekhate hain," Nikki ne kaha. "ham iska pata lagaane ke liye anumaan ka upayog kar sakate hain ki yeh kis sankhya ke kareeb hai."

"Anumaan kya hota hai?" Jay ne poochha.

"Main tumhen dikhaata hoon!" Nikki ne kaha.

No, that's not correct. Remember, in the last lesson, you learned how to compare numbers. If you can't remember how, it's fine to review that lesson again. If you need a hint, look at this .

hint_content.html:
If two numbers have different numbers of places, the one with more places is the larger number.

Otherwise, if the two numbers have the same number of places, start by comparing the leftmost digits. If those digits are the same, continue to the next greatest place, and keep going until you find two different digits. That will tell you which number is bigger.

content.html:
Before we help Jaime out in the arcade, let’s see if you remember how to compare numbers.

Which is largest: the price of french fries ($5), the price of a drink ($3), the price of a sandwich ($11), or the price of a salad ($15)?

hi.html: Shuru karne se pehle, hum dekhte hain ki agar aapko yaad hai ki do sakhyon ki tulna kaise karte hain. Kis sankhya sab se badi hai?: french fries ki keemat, jo 5 dollar hai, ek pey ki keemat, jo 3 dollar hai, ek sandwich ki keemat, jo 11 dollar hai, ya phir ek salad ki keemat, jo 15 dollar hai?
nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Yaad rakho, pichla paath main aapne seekha ki do sankhya ki tulna kaise karte hain. Aap wo phir se dekh sakte hain.
Sahi hai!

Agar do sankhyon mein alag-alag staan ki sankhya hai, toh badi sankhya adhik staanon wali sankhya hai. Lekin, agar staan ki sankhya samaan hai, toh pehle sabse baen staan se shuru karo. Agar dono sankhyon main ank samaan hai, toh uske bilkul daen wala ank ko dekho. Aao yeh karte rahe, jab tak do alag-alag ank mile. Phir, unke tulna karo.

hint_content.html:
If two numbers have different numbers of places, the one with more places is the larger number.

Otherwise, if the two numbers have the same number of places, start by comparing the leftmost digits. If those digits are the same, continue to the next greatest place, and keep going until you find two different digits. That will tell you which number is bigger.

Aao yeh karte rahe, jab tak do alag-alag ank mile. Phir, unke tulna karo.

content.html:
"Now that you know how to round up," said Nic, "let’s learn how to round down! The steps are similar to before:

  1. Find the digit at the place you're rounding to.
  2. Look at the digit one place to its right. If that digit is 4 or smaller, we should round down. This means you don't need to do anything to the digit in the place you’re rounding to.
  3. Everything to the right of that digit then becomes 0.

"See if you can use this to round 712 to the tens place," Nic said.

"OK," said Jaime. "We're rounding to the tens place. The digit on the right of that is 2, so we round down. So, we leave the 1 in the tens place alone. Everything else on the right becomes 0. So, 712 rounds down to 710!"

hi.html:
Nikki ne kaha, "ab aap jaanate hain ki kaise upar ka anumaan lagate hai. Ab seekhte hain ki neecha ka anumaan kaise lagana hai!"

1. jis sthaan par aap anumaan laga rahe hain, us sthaan ko dekho.

2. Jo bhi ank ko usake daeen or ek sthaan par hai, wo dekho. Agar vah ank 4 ya 4 se chhota hai, to hamen neecha ka anumaan karna hai. Isaka matalab hai ki aapako us sthaan ka ank ko kuchh bhee karna hoga.

3. Lekin, uss ank ke daeen or sab kuchh 0 ho jaata hai.

"Aya aap 712 ko dasiyon sthaan tak anumaan laga hain," Nikki ne kaha.

"Theek hai," Jay ne kaha. "Hum dasiyon sthaan par anumaan laga rahe hain. Uss ke daeen or ank 2 hai, isliye ham neeche ka anumaan laga rahe hain. Isliye, ham ank 1 ko dasiyon sthaan par chhod dete hain. Lekin, uske daen or pe sab kuchh 0 ho jaata hai. Islye, 712 ka neecha anumaan 710 hai! "

content.html:
“Exactly!" said Nic. "So, if we have five or more, we can round this up to 10 slices. But, if we have fewer than five, we’re closer to zero slices."

"In general, rounding means finding a value close to the original number, but with more zeros at the end. For example, we can round 96,243 to 96,000 because 2 is less than 5. That can help us remember the rough value of the number, but without having to remember so many digits."

"I see," said Jaime. "But how do you know whether 96,243 rounds to 96,000 or 96,200?"

"We need to say what place we're rounding to," said Nic. "So, 96,243 rounded to the nearest thousand is 96,000, but 96,243 rounded to the nearest hundred is 96,200."

hi.html:
"Bilkul!" Nikki ne kaha. Isliye, agar hamaare paas 5, ya 5 se adhik slices hain, to iska anumaan 10 slice se zyaada kharaab hai. Lekin, agar hamaare paas 5 se kam hai, toh iska anumaan 0 slice se zyaada khareeb hai."

"Anumaan ka arth hai ki sankhya ke kareeb mooly ka pata lagaana, lekin ant mein adhik shoony ke saath. udaaharan ke lie, ham 96243 ka anumaan 96000 laga sakate hain, kyonki 2 5 se kam hai. Isse hamen kisi mooly ko yaad rakhane mein madad mil sakatee hai, lekin itne ankon ko yaad karne ke bina. "

"Main samajh gaya," Jay ne kaha. "Lekin, aap kaise jaanate hain ki 96243 ka anumaan 96000 ya 96200 hai?"

"Hume kehna hai kee ham kis sthaan tak anumaan laga rahe hain" Nikki ne kaha. "Toh, 96243 nikuttam hajaar ka anumaan 96000 hai, lekin 96243 nikuttam sau ka anumaan 96200 hai."

content.html:
Congratulations on completing this lesson! With your knowledge of place values, you've helped Jaime win a cool bike!

Now that you've learned Place Values, you might want to try other topics, like Addition and Subtraction. If you want to get more practice with the concepts in the story, try out the practice questions and see if you can get a perfect score!

hi.html:
Iss paath ko poora karne ke lie badhai ho! sthaan moolyon ke apane gyaan ke saath, aapane Jay ko ek bada cycle jeetane mein madad ki hai!

Ab kyunki aapne staan maanon ko seekhli hai, to aap addition aur subtraction jaise aur paath padhne ki koshish kar sakte ho. Agar aapko staan moolyon ki aur abhyaas karni hai, to abhyaas prashnon dekhen!

content.html:
“Yay! It looks like you won, Jaime. Congratulations!” Nic cheered.

“Thanks, Nic! I’m excited to exchange my score for a prize! Let’s go!” Jaime said.

hi.html: "Wah! Lagata hai ki aap jeet gae, Jay. badhaee ho!" Nikki ne khush ho ke kaha. “Dhanyavaad, Nikki! Ab, mein ek puraskaar ke liye apne score ka aadaan-pradaan kar satka hoon! Chalo chalate hain!" Jay ne kaha.

content.html:
"To round to a certain place, we just need to look at the digit in the place to the right," said Nic. "Just like with the pizza, we ask ourselves, is that digit closer to 10 or to 0? If it's closer to 10, we round up, otherwise, we round down. So, for example, 4 rounds down to 0 and 6 rounds up to 10."

“Wait a minute, Nic!” said Jaime. “5 is in the middle. It’s equally close to 10 and 0.”

“Good catch, Jaime! Since 5 is in the middle, there's a special rule for it. When you see a 5, you should round up. Make sure you remember this!” Nic said.

hi.html:
"Ek sthaan ka anumaan lagaane ke liye, hamen bas us sthaan par daeen or ank ko dekhana hoga," Nikki ne kaha. "Jaise pizza ke saath, ham khud se poochhate hain, kya woh ank 10 ya 0 ke kareeb hai? agar yeh 10 ke kareeb hai, to ham upar ki anumaan lagate hain, varna, ham neeche ki anumaan lagate hain. isliye, udaaharan ke lie, 4 ka neeche ki anumaan 0 aur 6 ka upar ki anumaan 10."

"Ek minute ruko, Nikki!" Jay ne kaha. “5 beech mein hai. Yeh 10 aur 0 se samaan doori par hai. ”

"Sahi baat, Jay! Kyunki 5 beech mein hai, Isliye iske liye ek vishesh niyam hai. Jab aap ek 5 ko dekhte hain, to aapako upar ki anumaan lagaani hai. Sunishchit karo ki aapako iski yah yaad rahe! ” Nikki ne kaha.

explanation.html:
Start by looking at the thousands place of 80978.

The digit to its right is 9, which is "5 or bigger", so we round up. We add 1 to the thousands place: 0 + 1 = 1. So, the 0 in the thousands place becomes 1.

Then, we change all the digits to the right to 0. This gives us 81000.

The digit in the ten-thousands place is 2. So, we need to look at the digit to its right, which is 7.

If that digit is "5 or greater", we round up. Otherwise, we round down.

Since 7 is "5 or greater", we round up.

That means we add one to the digit in the ten thousands place, and turn everything to the right to zero. Try it!

What is 27,510 rounded to the ten thousands place?

"Ek aur karte hain!" Nikki ne kaha.

"27510 das hajaaron tak ka anumaan kya hoga?"
Kyunki 7 5 se bada hai, hum upar ka anumaan lagate hain. Iska matkab hai ki hum 1 ko hajaaron staan par add karte hain. Try karo!

hint_content.html: The digit in the hundreds place is 4.
The digit to the right of that 4 is 0.
You need to figure out whether 0 is "5 or greater", or "4 or less". This will tell you whether to round up or round down.
Since 0 is "4 or less", you should round down.
Remember to change all the digits on the right of the hundreds place to 0s before submitting your answer!

content.html:
“How about another one?” Nic said.

What is 14,402 rounded to the hundreds place?

hi.html: Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Kya aap ek ank likhna bul gaye? Phir se koshish karo!
4 ke daen or ka ank 0 hai.
Yaad rakho ki daen wale sab staanon ke ank 0 hone chahiye.

"Ek aur karte hain!" Nikki ne kaha.

"14402 saikadon staan tak ka anumaan kya hoga?"
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Hum phir se samajhte hain.
Sahi hai!
Kyunki 0 5 se kam hai, aapko neeche ka anumaan karna hai.
Saikadon staan ka ank 4 hai.
Nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Sunishchit karo ki aap sahi staan tak anumaan kar rahe hai. Aapne hajaaron staan tak anumaan kiya hai, lekin humme saikadon staan tak karna tha. Phir se koshish karo.
Aapko pata lagana hai ki 0 kya ank 5 se bada hai? Ya kam?

value: 71,050 because 5 is halfway between 0 and 10, so you should round down
71,050 because 5 is less than 6, so you should round down

You cannot use 5 to round the number because 5 is halfway between 1 and 10

hint_content.html: If the digit we're looking at is greater than or equal to the special number 5, we round up. If the digit we're look at is less than the special number 5, we round down.

content.html:
“Let’s do another one!” Nic said.

What is 71,055 rounded to the tens place?

hi.html:
"Ek aur karte hain!" Nikki ne kaha.

"71055 das staan tak anumaan kya hoga?"
nahi, yeh sahi nahi hai. Hum phir se samajhte hain.
Sahi hai!
Jo ank hum dekh rahe hain, agar wo 5 hai ya phir 5 se bada hai, hum upar ka anumaan lagate hain. Varna, hum neeche ka anumaan lagate hain.

content.html:
Great job! Now, Jaime knows how to round a number. He also knows that his score is closer to 15,000, so he can claim the bike he wanted!

Jaime wrote down everything Nic taught him so that he could use it to round numbers in the future. You should, too!

Here's how to round a number:

  • First, find the digit at the place you’re rounding to.

  • Look at the digit in the place to the right. If that digit is 5 or more, we round up by adding 1 to the digit in the place we’re rounding to. Otherwise, if it is 4 or less, we round down and do not change the digit in the place we’re rounding to.

  • Finally, find all digits to the right of the place you're rounding to, and change them to zero.

hi.html:
Bohot badiya kaam! Ab, Jay jaanata hai ki ek sankhya ka kaise anumaan lagana hai. vah yah bhee jaanata hai ki usaka score 15000 ke kareeb hai, isalie vah apani cycle le jaa sakta hai!

Jay ne sab kuch likha, taaki woh ussko yaad rakhen. Aap bhi likh sakte hain, taako aapko bhi yaad rahe:

sabase pahale, us sthaan par ank dekho jahaan tak aap anumaan laga rahe hai.

Uske daen or ka ank ko dekho. Agar woh ank 5 ya adhik hai, to ham us sthaan mein 1 ank add karte hain, jahaan ham anumaan laga rahe hain. Varna, agar yeh ank 4 ya usse kam hai, to ham neeche ka anumaan lagate hain aur jis sthaan par ham anumaan laga rahe hain, usko kuch nahin karte hai.

Ant mein, jis sthaan tak aap anumaan laga hain, usake daeen or sabhee ank ko 0 banate hain.

“Now, let’s try rounding your score to the thousands place!” Nic suggested.

"What is Jaime’s score (14,820) rounded to the thousands place?"

"Ab, hum aakhir aapka score ka anumaan karenge." Nikki ne kaha.

Jay ka score (14820)  hajaaron staan ka anumaan kya hoga?
Sahi hai!

No, that's not correct. Take a look at the picture! More than half of the pizza is still there, so this is closer to a full pizza. Try again.

value: A finished pizza with no slices left

content.html:
"Let’s say we ordered a pizza for lunch, and cut it into 10 slices. After eating some of it, there are six slices left. Rounding is like figuring out whether this is closer to a 'whole' pizza of 10 slices, or closer to an 'empty' pizza with no slices left," Nic explained.

If we have six slices of pizza, are we closer to a whole pizza of 10 slices, or to a finished pizza with no slices left?

hi.html:
"Maan lo ki hamne khane ke lie pizza mangvaya hai, aur isse 10 slice mein kaat diya hai. iske kuchh khaane ke baad, 6 slice bache hain. Anumaan yah pata lagaane kee tarah hai ki kya ye 10 slice ke poore pizza ke kareeb hai ya phir bina kisee slais ke khaalee pizza ke kareeb hai" Nikki ne samjhaaya.

Agar hamaare paas Pizza ke 6 slice hain, to kya hum 10 slice ke poore pizza ke kareeb hain, ya phir kisee slice ke bina, khaali pizza ke?
Nahi, yeh sanhi nahi hai. Tasveer ko dhyaan se dekho- ismein, aadha se zyaada pizza baccha hai. Isliye, yeh ek pura pizza se zyaada khareeb hai.
Sahi hai!

exploration.title: Rounding numbers
exploration.objective: In this lesson, you'll learn how to round a number to a specific place value.
